FuncDef:
The isis ti-lfa disable command disables TI-LFA on an IS-IS interface.
The undo isis ti-lfa disable command enables TI-LFA on an IS-IS interface.
By default, TI-LFA is enabled on an IS-IS interface automatically.
CLIs: isis ti-lfa disable [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]
isis process-id <process-id> ti-lfa disable [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]
undo isis ti-lfa disable [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]
undo isis process-id <process-id> ti-lfa disable [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables TI-LFA on an IS-IS Level-1 interface.
-

Enables or disables TI-LFA on an IS-IS Level-2 interface.
-

Enables or disables TI-LFA on all IS-IS interfaces.
If no level is specified, TI-LFA is disabled by default on all IS-IS interfaces.
-

Specifies the IID of an IS-IS multi-instance process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the ti-lfa command is run, TI-LFA is automatically enabled on all IS-IS interfaces. To disable TI-LFA on a specified interface, run the isis ti-lfa disable command in the interface view.
Precautions
If the ti-lfa command is not run, the isis ti-lfa disable command can be run but cannot take effect on an interface.
If the isis ti-lfa disable and ti-lfa commands are run in sequence, the isis ti-lfa disable command still takes effect.
If an interface bound to a VPN instance, the interface does not support TI-LFA.
